Package practicalexercises.assessment1.persistence

Class PersistenceController

java.lang.Object
practicalexercises.assessment1.persistence.PersistenceController
public class PersistenceController extends Object
The PersistenceController class manages the interaction with the persistence layer, providing methods to create, read, update, and delete employee data among others

This class interfaces with the EmployeeJpaController for performing CRUD operations on the employee entities stored in the database (employee)

Usage example:

 
 PersistenceController controller = new PersistenceController();
 controller.createEmployee(employee);
 controller.findEmployee(employeeId);
 controller.allEmployees();
 controller.modifyEmployee(updatedEmployee);
 controller.deleteEmployee(employeeId);
 controller.deleteAllEmployees();
 controller.employeesByJobTitle(jobTitleInput);
 controller.employeesByName(nameInput);
 controller.employeesByLastName(lastNameInput);
 controller.restartingDataListAndMap();

The class also includes methods for searching employees by job title, name, or last name, as well as resetting data lists and maps to avoid accumulation of search results.

      Final common step on the methods:

    • employeesByJobTitle

      public Map<String,List<Employee>> employeesByJobTitle(String jobTitle)
      Evaluates if exists any MATCH coincidence or CONTAINS any similar JobTitle input
      Parameters:
      jobTitle - String input to look for coincidence inside the database with the Job Title
      Returns:
      The coincidences in a Map with the String key: MATCH/CONTAINS in case there are, and the List of Employee with the results for each case
      See Also:
      • Employee.jobTitle

    • employeesByName

      public Map<String,List<Employee>> employeesByName(String firstName)
      Evaluates if exists any MATCH coincidence or CONTAINS any similar the first name input
      Parameters:
      firstName - String input to look for coincidence inside the database with the first name
      Returns:
      The coincidences in a Map with the String key: MATCH/CONTAINS in case there are, and the List of Employee with the results for each case
      See Also:
      • Employee.firstName
